title: 1974 Lamborghini Espada Series III Project
description: This 1974 Lamborghini Espada is one of 472 Series III examples built between 1972 and 1978, approximately 55 of which came equipped from the factory with a Chrysler TorqueFlite three-speed automatic transmission. The car is said to have been initially delivered to California and later spent time in Texas before being exported to Kuwait in the mid-2000s, where it reportedly remained under the care of the country's then Prime Minister through 2022, when it was brought back to the US. Finished in burgundy over tan leather upholstery, the car is powered by a 3.9-liter quad-cam V12 equipped with six Weber carburetors. Additional equipment includes 15" Campagnolo magnesium wheels, a sunroof, a quad-exit exhaust system, power windows, air conditioning, and a Kenwood cassette player. The current owner acquired the car in 2022 and service performed since then is said to have involved overhauling the carburetors as well as replacing the fuel pump, fuel filter, and battery, though the car has a cylinder head gasket leak and requires additional service before being driven. This S3 Espada is being offered as a running project in California with manufacturer's literature and a clean Florida title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 1974 Lamborghini Espada Series III Project at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #167,154.

Creasing is noted on the seating surfaces, tears are visible along the driver’s seat upholstery, and the carpets and headliner show wear.
